description: Privacy-first coordination for Muslim families during times of loss

community.note: This overlay follows general Sunni practices. Specific madhab variations (Hanafi, Shafi'i, Maliki, Hanbali) may require adjustments.

language.note: Heritage languages honor the linguistic diversity of the global Muslim community

CASUALTY.note: The Prophet ﷺ permitted mourning for 3 days; extended for widow's iddah

ritual_timeline.label: Informing Loved Ones
ritual_timeline.description: Gently informing immediate family and close ones
ritual_timeline.guidance: Recite 'Inna lillahi wa inna ilayhi raji'un' - Indeed, to Allah we belong and to Him we shall return

ritual_timeline.label: Ritual Washing
ritual_timeline.description: Washing of the deceased with dignity and care
sequence: Wash with water and sidr (lotus leaf)
Final wash with water and camphor
ritual_timeline.note: Performed by same-gender family members or trained community volunteers

ritual_timeline.label: Shrouding
ritual_timeline.description: Wrapping the deceased in white cloth with love and respect

details.female: Five cloths (izaar, qamees, khimar, lifafah, hizam)

ritual_timeline.label: Funeral Prayer
ritual_timeline.description: Congregational prayer seeking mercy and forgiveness for the departed
ritual_timeline.note: A communal obligation (fard kifayah); if some perform it, obligation is lifted from all

ritual_timeline.label: Burial
ritual_timeline.description: Returning the departed to the earth with dignity

details.depth: Deep enough that scent does not emerge and animals cannot reach
details.talqeen: Prompting with words of faith at burial (practice varies by madhab)

ritual_timeline.label: Condolence Period
ritual_timeline.description: Community offers condolences and support to the bereaved family
ritual_timeline.guidance: Visitors bring food, offer prayers, and provide comfort. Family should not host or prepare meals.
ritual_timeline.note: The Prophet ﷺ said: 'Prepare food for the family of Ja'far, for there has come to them that which preoccupies them'

ritual_timeline.label: Widow's Waiting Period
ritual_timeline.description: Sacred period for a widow to mourn and observe certain restrictions
ritual_timeline.note: This is a Quranic obligation (2:234). Different from the general 3-day mourning period.

ritual_timeline.label: Remembrance Gatherings
ritual_timeline.description: Optional gatherings for Quran recitation and remembrance
ritual_timeline.scholarly_note: Some scholars view fixed-day gatherings as cultural rather than Sunnah. The permissibility varies by madhab and local tradition.

roles.label: Ghusl Team (Brothers)
roles.description: Trained volunteers who perform the sacred washing for male deceased
roles.sensitivity: This is a deeply honored service. Volunteers should be trained, patient, and maintain complete confidentiality.

roles.label: Ghusl Team (Sisters)
roles.description: Trained volunteers who perform the sacred washing for female deceased
roles.sensitivity: This is a deeply honored service. Volunteers should be trained, patient, and maintain complete confidentiality.

roles.label: Shrouding Team
roles.description: Volunteers who assist with wrapping the deceased in the burial shroud

roles.label: Grave Preparation Team
roles.description: Volunteers who prepare the final resting place with care

roles.label: Those Who Carry
roles.description: Volunteers honored to carry the deceased to their final rest

roles.label: Meal Coordinator
roles.description: Coordinates meal delivery so the bereaved family need not cook or host

roles.label: Transport Support
roles.description: Provides transport for family members during this difficult time

roles.label: Announcement Coordinator
roles.description: Manages respectful community announcements with family approval

donations.label: Sadaqah (Charity)
donations.description: General charitable donation, seeking reward for the departed's soul

donations.label: Sadaqah Jariyah (Ongoing Charity)
donations.description: Continuous benefit - such as a well, school, or masjid - whose reward continues after death

donations.label: Fidyah
donations.description: Compensation for missed obligatory fasts the departed was unable to make up

donations.label: Burial Support
donations.description: Direct support for funeral and burial expenses

providers.label: Imam
providers.description: Religious leader to lead the funeral prayer

providers.label: Islamic Funeral Services
providers.description: Funeral services that honor Islamic requirements

providers.label: Islamic Cemetery
providers.description: Cemetery with Islamic burial section, graves facing Qibla

theme.design_note: Colors chosen for dignity and calm; green represents Islam, brown represents earth

emotional_design.principle: Every interaction should feel like guidance from a trusted elder
